  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Projects Control Manager",
  "description": "WTS Energy -&nbsp;Our client is Africa&rsquo;s leading independent E&amp;P player with a diverse portfolio of eight (8) oil and gas assets in prolific basins across Africa.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Projects Control Manager

Job Location: Lagos&nbsp;
Line Manager: Head of Facilities &amp; Projects

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly skilled Project Controls Manager to work with our engineering and project team.
	The role includes overseeing the financials of projects within the asset, collaborating with project manager to determine budget and deadlines, tracking each stage of a project to ensure the project stays within the budgetary constraints.
	The individual has the overall responsibility for relating to the timely and cost-efficient completion of various corporate projects.
	The role holder shall be responsible for continually monitoring and evaluating each step of a project to ensure that it meets budgetary and deadline goals and assist in setting project budgets, be involved in assembling a project&rsquo;s team and setting task schedules.
	He/she shall have the ability to recognize which areas of project development need to be re-addressed to maintain efficiency, schedule and cost control.


Key&nbsp;Responsibilities


	Review project budget and deadlines with project manager.
	Develop project schedules, budgets, and progress &amp; cost reports.
	Forecast project schedules, cost and completion.
	Create and adjust project budgets.
	Develop and manage company&rsquo;s project master schedule and resource plan.
	Develop and present monthly schedule &amp; cost status reports to management regarding schedule progress (using s-curves), revenue recognition, earned value analysis, forecasting and contract status utilizing MS Excel, MS Project, Primavera, and related software.
	Manage project progress and productivity of project contractors; monitor and track monthly progress &amp; costs, and change project orders.
	Monitor project to ensure it meets budget guidelines
	Ensure that all projects are delivered on time, within scope and within budget
	Develop, manage and monitor project specific budgets, cash flow projections and monthly project financial reconciliation.
	Responsible for control of work-in-progress, ensures accurate client billings on related projects.
	Prepare status reports and other related project planning and controls documentation, including the collection, analysis, and presentation of regular information from major contractors.
	Analyse performance data to establish performance metrics.
	Coordinate payments to subcontractors and vendors.
	Develop risk mitigations processes.
	Compare ongoing project activities with the project management plan and project performance baseline
	Contribute to selection, training and overseeing project controls team members.
	Offer coaching and guidance to junior team members


Requirements
Professional Qualifications:


	A Degree in Engineering, Quantities Surveying, or related science fields.
	A minimum of 15 years of experience of relevant projects controls work, with 5 years of these being in the field; special consideration will be given to field experience, particularly in the oil &amp; gas fabrication, construction &amp; installation industry.


Knowledge &amp; Skills Required:


	Knowledge, experience and proficiency demonstrated in all the activities described above.
	Must be able to multi-task and demonstrate the ability to work with a diverse work group of vendors, executive managers, contractors, consultants and other professionals
	Sound knowledge and experience in ISO Quality Management System.
	Proficient with Microsoft Office Tools, especially Microsoft Projects and Microsoft Excel, project management software.
	Attention to details and very good cost controls and reporting skills.
	Flexible schedule.

Projects Control Manager Job at WTS Energy




        
    

        
        WTS Energy - Our client is Africa’s leading independent E&P player with a diverse portfolio of eight (8) oil and gas assets in prolific basins across Africa.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Projects Control Manager

Job Location: Lagos 
Line Manager: Head of Facilities & Projects

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly skilled Project Controls Manager to work with our engineering and project team.
	The role includes overseeing the financials of projects within the asset, collaborating with project manager to determine budget and deadlines, tracking each stage of a project to ensure the project stays within the budgetary constraints.
	The individual has the overall responsibility for relating to the timely and cost-efficient completion of various corporate projects.
	The role holder shall be responsible for continually monitoring and evaluating each step of a project to ensure that it meets budgetary and deadline goals and assist in setting project budgets, be involved in assembling a project’s team and setting task schedules.
	He/she shall have the ability to recognize which areas of project development need to be re-addressed to maintain efficiency, schedule and cost control.


Key Responsibilities


	Review project budget and deadlines with project manager.
	Develop project schedules, budgets, and progress & cost reports.
	Forecast project schedules, cost and completion.
	Create and adjust project budgets.
	Develop and manage company’s project master schedule and resource plan.
	Develop and present monthly schedule & cost status reports to management regarding schedule progress (using s-curves), revenue recognition, earned value analysis, forecasting and contract status utilizing MS Excel, MS Project, Primavera, and related software.
	Manage project progress and productivity of project contractors; monitor and track monthly progress & costs, and change project orders.
	Monitor project to ensure it meets budget guidelines
	Ensure that all projects are delivered on time, within scope and within budget
	Develop, manage and monitor project specific budgets, cash flow projections and monthly project financial reconciliation.
	Responsible for control of work-in-progress, ensures accurate client billings on related projects.
	Prepare status reports and other related project planning and controls documentation, including the collection, analysis, and presentation of regular information from major contractors.
	Analyse performance data to establish performance metrics.
	Coordinate payments to subcontractors and vendors.
	Develop risk mitigations processes.
	Compare ongoing project activities with the project management plan and project performance baseline
	Contribute to selection, training and overseeing project controls team members.
	Offer coaching and guidance to junior team members


Requirements
Professional Qualifications:


	A Degree in Engineering, Quantities Surveying, or related science fields.
	A minimum of 15 years of experience of relevant projects controls work, with 5 years of these being in the field; special consideration will be given to field experience, particularly in the oil & gas fabrication, construction & installation industry.


Knowledge & Skills Required:


	Knowledge, experience and proficiency demonstrated in all the activities described above.
	Must be able to multi-task and demonstrate the ability to work with a diverse work group of vendors, executive managers, contractors, consultants and other professionals
	Sound knowledge and experience in ISO Quality Management System.
	Proficient with Microsoft Office Tools, especially Microsoft Projects and Microsoft Excel, project management software.
	Attention to details and very good cost controls and reporting skills.
	Flexible schedule.

General Manager Job at Updeal Resources




        
    

        
        Updeal Resource - Our client is a fast-growing player in the ice cream production industry, known for its commitment to quality, innovation, and customer satisfaction. As the company scales operations and expands its market footprint, there is a critical need to bring on board a seasoned General Manager to drive the next phase of growth.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job PPosition: General Manager

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a strategic and results-driven General Manager to lead our ice cream production and retail business.
	The ideal candidate will have end-to-end ownership of operations, financial performance, team leadership, and market growth.
	This role requires a commercially minded leader capable of scaling production, optimizing retail performance, and driving profitability while ensuring quality and compliance.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership & Business Development:


	Define and implement business strategies to drive growth, operational efficiency, and profitability.
	Identify and pursue new market opportunities, including B2B sales, distribution partnerships, and retail expansion.
	Set performance targets and lead business planning, budgeting, and forecasting.


Operations Management:


	Oversee daily operations across production, supply chain, logistics, and retail units.
	Ensure consistent product quality, equipment reliability, and compliance with food safety and health regulations.
	Introduce best practices in manufacturing and inventory management to reduce waste and optimize output.


Financial Oversight:


	Take full responsibility for cost optimization.
	Monitor and analyze financial performance, making data-driven decisions to improve margins and revenue.
	Prepare regular financial and operational reports for the board and stakeholders.


People & Team Leadership:


	Build and lead high-performing cross-functional teams across production, sales, and operations.
	Promote a culture of accountability, safety, customer focus, and continuous improvement.


Customer & Stakeholder Relations:


	Ensure high customer satisfaction across all retail and distribution channels.
	Handle key client relationships and support business development initiatives.
	Resolve escalated issues in a professional, brand-affirming manner.


Requirements


	7 - 10 years of senior management experience, preferably in food manufacturing, FMCG, or retail.
	Strong track record in operational efficiency, financial management, and team leadership.
	Deep understanding of supply chain, production processes, and regulatory standards.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and strategic decision-making skills.
	Entrepreneurial mindset with a practical, execution-driven approach.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: updealcareers@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Mshel Homes Limited is a real estate development and marketing company incorporated in 2018 with a unique vision to be the leading real estate company in Nigeria, with an outstanding reputation for honesty, integrity and impeccable customer service.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cost Accountant
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Summary


	The Cost Accountant is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and reporting financial data related to the costs of business operations, especially around property development, construction, and materials usage.
	This role focuses on cost accounting procedures, ensuring accurate cost allocation, inventory valuation, and financial reporting that supports profitability analysis and pricing decisions at Mshel Homes Limited.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate cost records and cost allocation across departments and projects.
	Analyze costs of materials, labor, and overhead for real estate and construction projects.
	Monitor and track cost trends, identify cost drivers, and suggest areas of improvement.
	Manage inventory valuation and reconciliation (building materials, finishing materials, etc.).
	Ensure proper cost allocation to work-in-progress (WIP), finished properties, and unsold inventory.
	Periodically review and update the standard cost of items based on current market data.
	Support monthly closing processes by preparing cost-related journal entries and reconciliations.
	Assist in the preparation of cost of sales reports and contribution margin analysis.
	Provide data for the preparation of financial statements and management reports.
	Collaborate with the finance team in preparing and monitoring project budgets and forecasts.
	Compare actual costs with budgeted costs and explain variances.
	Contribute to pricing strategies by providing accurate cost-based data.
	Ensure all cost accounting processes adhere to internal policies and relevant accounting standards.
	Participate in audits, stock counts, and internal reviews to maintain financial integrity.
	Assist in the design and implementation of cost control systems and tools.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy and timeliness of cost reports and journal entries.
	Variance analysis turnaround time.
	Inventory valuation accuracy and reconciliation compliance.
	Contribution to improved cost efficiencies and margin tracking.


Requirements
Education &amp; Experience:


	B.Sc/HND in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum of 3&ndash;5 years hands-on experience in cost accounting, preferably in a construction or real estate company.
	Experience in ERP or accounting software (e.g., Sage, QuickBooks, SAP).


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Solid understanding of cost accounting principles and practices.
	Strong analytical and quantitative skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and financial reporting tools.
	Detail-oriented, with a high level of accuracy and integrity.
	Good communication and organizational skills.


Preferred Qualifications:


	ICAN, ACCA, or other relevant professional certification (in progress or completed).
	Experience working with construction cost structures, site cost management, or property developmen

	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
	Career growth and professional development opportunities.
	Work in a dynamic and innovative real estate&nbsp;company
	Access to exclusive investment and tools
	Positive work environment.


Method of Application

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Warehouse Officer",
  "description": "Rotic Aluminium Extrusion was established in 2023 and is a growing leader in the aluminium extrusion industry in Africa, dedicated to delivering high-quality aluminum products to various industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Awka, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time (On-Site)

Description


	This is a full-time on-site Warehouse Officer role located in Awka, Anambra state.
	As a WarehouseOfficer, you will be responsible for recording stocks, organizing inventory to ensure the smooth and efficient operation of the supply chain within an Aluminium Extrusion Factory,


Key Responsibilities


	Organize and store items systematically in designated locations.
	Optimize warehouse space through strategic product arrangement.
	Clearly label shelves, bins, and products for easy identification and retrieval.
	Maintain a clean, safe, and well-organized warehouse environment.
	Implement and enforce stock rotation methods, such as FIFO (First In, First Out).
